description: NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks to the New York Times' food critic Pete Wells about his retirement after 12 years at the critic's table.
title: Longtime 'NYT' food critic reflects on 12 years at the table

description: The idea of deporting millions of undocumented immigrants gained traction during the RNC. Speakers talked about how a second Trump administration will carry out the "largest deportation in history."
title: Trump has promised deportations on an unprecedented scale

description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken at the Aspen Security Forum on a wide range of the most pressing diplomatic questions.
title: Secretary of State Blinken on Hamas-Israel ceasefire deal and Russia's war in Ukraine

description: Wall Street Journal correspondent Evan Gershkovich was sentenced to 16 years in a Russian prison on charges of espionage. His employer and the U.S. government have said he is innocent and the trial is a sham. We hear the latest from Moscow and reaction from the U.S.
title: A U.S. Journalist is Sentenced in Russia

description: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been sentenced to 16 years for alleged espionage in a trial that his newspaper and the U.S. government calls a sham.
title: Russian court sentences ‘Wall Street Journal’ reporter to 16 years in prison colony

description: A joint investigation by NPR, Texas Public Radio and the program 1A finds that more than 250 workers have died in trench cave-ins over the last decade. Deaths that were preventable, experts say.
title: 250+ workers have died in preventable trench cave-ins over a decade, probe finds

description: Much of Israel’s commercial capital Tel Aviv has returned to business-as-usual. But this sense of normality was shattered in a deadly predawn explosion Friday that rocked the city’s oceanfront.
title: A deadly explosion hit Tel Aviv's oceanfront before dawn

description:
In 2017, the Larry Nassar scandal rocked the Olympic community.

Hundreds of allegations of sexual abuse against the former USA Gymnastics doctor underscored how vulnerable athletes are — particularly when they're minors.

That year, Congress and the U.S. Olympic Committee had a solution.

The U.S. Center for SafeSport was founded to investigate and respond to allegations of sexual abuse and misconduct. The goal was for predators like Larry Nassar to never harm young athletes again.

Now, seven years later, SafeSport is facing scrutiny of its own — over whether it's made good on that promise.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: USA Gymnastics made a miraculous comeback — but is it actually safer for Olympians?

description: Trump showed some vulnerability while recounting what happened during the assassination attempt on his life. But he quickly moved on from any message of unity to a litany of familiar grievances.
title: Trump talks about national unity in RNC speech

description: Netflix says it will no longer offer its basic plan for U.S. and French subscribers, which had already been phased out of other markets.
title: Netflix ends its cheapest ad-free subscription

description: It's a big weekend for women's basketball. NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with Sabreena Merchant, who covers women's basketball for The Athletic, about the upcoming WNBA-All Star game.
title: WNBA All-Star game will showcase Team USA players before Olympics

description: One of the biggest IT outages ever caused mayhem around the world today, hobbling airlines, businesses and government agencies. A faulty update from the cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike is to blame.
title: A worldwide IT outage disrupted airlines, banks, hospitals and businesses today

description: Antony Blinken talks speaks on everything from the prospect of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, to the war in Ukraine and what the U.S. is doing to bring home Americans detained in Russia.
title: 'We're inside the 10-yard line': Secretary of state on an Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal

description: Four days, dozens of speakers and many balloons later, the 2024 Republican National Convention is officially over.
title: What we saw at the RNC in Milwaukee

description: The extreme heat searing the U.S. this summer is having an unexpected consequence thousands of feet in the air: It's causing some beverage cans on Southwest Airlines flights to burst when opened.
title: Soda cans are exploding on Southwest flights due to sky-high temperatures

description: Steven Johnson, who escaped from prison in 1994 while on a work detail, was arrested in Macon, Ga., on Tuesday. He had been living there since 2011 and had assumed the identity of a dead child.
title: Escaped prisoner found in Georgia 30 years later, using the identity of a dead child

description: Top U.N. court says Israel's occupation of West Bank is contrary to international law
title: Top U.N. court says Israel's occupation of West Bank, East Jerusalem is 'unlawful'

description: Top UN court says Israel's occupation of West Bank is contrary to international law
title: Top UN court says Israel's occupation of West Bank, East Jerusalem is "unlawful"

description: A new dinosaur has been discovered in Utah by North Carolina researchers and paleontologists. They believe it was a burrowing species.
title: A newly-discovered dinosaur may have spent part of its life underground

description: It's been a rough few weeks for President Biden as his party's leaders express doubts he should stay in the race. On Friday, more lawmakers said he should step aside — but BOLD PAC endorsed him.
title: Biden's campaign says he'll be back on the trail next week despite Democratic doubts

description: We all know the feeling of choking under pressure—but why does this happen? Cognitive scientist Sian Beilock shares the science behind why we mess up in high-stakes situations... and how to avoid it.
title: Why we choke under pressure, according to a cognitive scientist

description: A global computer glitch apparently triggered by software distributed by cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike caused widespread global outages late Thursday and into Friday morning.
title: Major Microsoft outage disrupts flights and banking around the world

description: Fifty Black sailors were convicted of mutiny after a massive Naval disaster during World War II. This week the Navy finally cleared their names.
title: Navy exonerates 256 Black sailors unjustly punished over 1944 port explosion

description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Democratic political analyst Bakari Sellers if it's inevitable that Joe Biden will withdraw from the presidential race.
title: Biden battles ongoing calls to withdraw from the presidential race

description: Federal investigators are piecing together what led the gunman to try to kill former President Trump. There’s also a push to get to the bottom of how this massive security failure was able to happen.
title: In the 6 days since the attempted Trump assassination, investigators are digging deep

description: The Republican National Convention wrapped up with a 90-minute nomination acceptance speech from former President Donald Trump, in which he recalled how he was wounded by gunfire on Saturday.
title: Former President Trump accepts the GOP presidential nomination for the 3rd time

description: The Houthis in Yemen, who've been firing at Israel throughout the war in Gaza, claimed responsibility. This is the first Houthi attack to penetrate the heart of Israel.
title: A drone explodes near the U.S. Embassy branch office in Tel Aviv killing 1 person

description: In collaboration with Texas Public Radio and member station WAMU's program "1A," NPR's investigation team finds that 250 workers have died in trench collapses in the past decade.
title: NPR teams investigate a dangerous problem for construction workers: trench cave-ins

description: Some low-income families are keeping their homes dangerously hot in an effort to save money on their electricity bill as summer temperatures heat up.
title: Families sacrifice comfort and safety to keep electric bills in check, research shows

description: Every four years, party conventions bring together delegates from across the country, many of whom make sure their outfits sparkle. And this year, they showed off their looks on the Republican National Convention's red carpet.
title: Fashion meets politics on the RNC's red carpet

description: Donald Trump formally accepts the Republican presidential nomination -- in a more subdued speech as he aims to widen his support. And pressure mounts on President Biden to end his reelection bid.
title: Morning news brief

description: Students can now opt between several versions of the test: the ACT core exam (which includes reading, math and English), the ACT plus writing, the ACT plus science or the ACT plus science and writing.
title: The science section of the ACT exam will now be optional

description: An Olympics anti-terrorism perimeter along the banks of the River Seine seals off a miles-long area to Parisians and tourists who hadn’t applied in advance for a pass.
title: Paris police are sealing off the Seine River ahead of the Olympics opening ceremony

description: A subdued and solemn Trump accepted the GOP nomination for president with a promise to unify a divided country.
title: WATCH: Donald J. Trump's 2024 RNC acceptance speech

description: Former President Donald Trump opened his presidential nominating speech with an emotional recounting of the shooting at his rally last week that left him injured and killed another.
title: Trump recounts assassination attempt: 'I'm not supposed to be here'

description: The 2024 Republican National Convention in Milwaukee has wrapped. Here are a few of the key speeches in case you missed it.
title: WATCH: RNC speeches from J.D. Vance, Hulk Hogan, Dana White and more

description: The 2024 Republican National Convention in Milwaukee has wrapped. Here are a few of the key speeches in case you missed it.
title: WATCH: RNC speeches from J.D. Vance, Hulk Hogan, Dana White and more

description: The former president spoke on the final night of the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee on Thursday, recounting in detail for the first time the assassination attempt on his life.
title: Trump accepts the Republican nomination for president

description: During his presidential nomination acceptance speech, Donald Trump recounts his feelings and reaction to the shooting at a rally that injured him and killed a supporter.
title: A solemn Trump recounts details of assassination attempt: 'I'm not supposed to be here'

description: Before former President Donald Trump's marquee address tonight, the schedule of speakers has sought to show a softer, friendlier side of Trump than his persona as president and on the campaign trail.
title: RNC speakers want to separate the president from the person to show softer side of Trump
